channel.title: R on Programming Methods for Data Retrieval & Management
channel.description: Recent content in R on Programming Methods for Data Retrieval & Management

item.title: [Intro to Computational Thinking] R Basics 1
item.description: 👋 Welcome Welcome to to the course! This is the first of 2 sets of exercises introducing you to the R programming language1 that we will use throughout the course. This and the next lesson are optional. Their intended for you if you are not that familiar with R, or you would like to practice your R basics before getting started. 📝 Lesson Preview Set up R and RStudio

item.title: [Intro to Computational Thinking] R Basics 2
item.description: 📝 Lesson Preview Functions Control Flow if statements for loops apply() Parallel computation Functions If objects are the nouns of the R language, functions are the verbs. They do things to objects. Let’s use the mean function as an example. This function takes the mean of a numeric vector object. Remember our numeric_vector object from Lesson 1: numeric_vector <- c(2.

item.title: File Organisation and Tidy Data Structures
item.description: 📝 Lesson Preview Why is file management important? What is tidy data? Manipulating tidy data (1) 📣 Lecture slides

item.title: GET Tidy Data
item.description: 📝 Lesson Preview What is public data? Retrieving and cleaning (tabular) public data Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) Cleaning grouped data 📣 Lecture slides

item.title: GET and Parse HTML Data
item.description: 📝 Lesson Preview Parse JSON (nested data formats) HTTP verbs (GET, POST, HEAD, PUT) and httr Parse HTML tables String manipulation 📣 Lecture slides

item.title: Parse PDFs and Text as Data
item.description: 📝 Lesson Preview Scraping tables in PDFs Text as data 📣 Lecture slides
